TYPE POLYPLACOPHORA 

Chiton ? sp. 

"Plastop/esiotype":\JC 10239 

S. Weller, 1903c, pp. 173-174, pi. 13, figs. 9-10 
 Middle Ordovician, Trenton Limestone. 

On a hill on the property of E. J. Hough, just back of the mill at Jack- 
 sonburg, near Blairstown, Warren County, New Jersey. S. Weller 
 Locality 174A. New Jersey Collection. 

Remarks: The original of UC 10239 may be at NJSM. 

Helminthochiton concinnus Richardson, 1956 

"Plastoholotype": PE 6681 
 Richardson, 1956, pp. 62-65, text-figs. 34-36 
 Smith, 1960, p. 148, fig. 33, no. la-c 
 Yochelson and Saunders, 1967, p. 12 

= Pterochiton carhonarius (Stevens, 1858) 
 Hoare et a!., 1972, pp. 677-678 

Middle Pennsylvanian, Desmoinesean, Westphalian C, Francis Creek 
 Shale. 

Probably Pit #1, Will or Grundy Counties, Illinois. Donated by E. S. 
 Richardson. 

Remarks: The original of PE 6681 is in the collection of Mrs. John 
 McLuckie, Coal City, Illinois. 

Pterochiton carhonarius (Stevens, 1858) 
 See: Helminthochiton concinnus Richardson, 1956 

10
